definition: to transfer (money to a bank account)
to pay the bill/to settle accounts/also written 結帳|结帐
to keep accounts/bookkeeping/to charge to an account
(accounting) to balance the books/to do the accounts/(fig.) to settle an account/to get one's revenge
variant of 買帳|买帐[mai3 zhang4]

sentences.english: Now let me record this transaction in your bankbook.
sentences.chinese: 现在我把这笔账录入到您的存折里。

sentences.english: Multiple sign-ups shall be grounds for immediate termination of all involved accounts.
sentences.chinese: 多迹象上升将是全部复杂的账的立即终止的理由。

sentences.english: The bank has credited ￡500 to his account.
sentences.chinese: 银行把收到的500英镑记到他的账上。

sentences.english: You wonder how many other banks have these kinds of risks on their books.
sentences.chinese: 不知道还有多少家银行的账上有这类风险。

sentences.english: Cash on hand tallies with the figure in the accounts.
sentences.chinese: 现款跟账上的数目没有出入。

sentences.english: She baled up her money on receiving the bill.
sentences.chinese: 她收到账单后勉强付了账。

sentences.english: I have squared up with him.
She has been compelled to dub up out of her own pocket.
sentences.chinese: 她被迫自己掏腰包付了账。

sentences.english: Some bookkeepers use a far fight-hand column to keep an up-to-date balance of the account.
sentences.chinese: 有的账薄在右边再加一栏，记载账户的最新余额。

sentences.english: The loan is on his account on Thursday. But the price is much higher than that on the previous day.
sentences.chinese: 那笔贷款周四到账了，当天的股价又高出一大截。

sentences.english: Waiter: Would you like to sign the bill or pay cash?
sentences.chinese: 请问您是签房账还是付现款？

sentences.english: The salesperson rang up all my items and the total price came to 1000 yuan.
sentences.chinese: 售货员将全部商品结了账，总额共1000元。

sentences.english: He checked out from the hotel early in the morning.
sentences.chinese: 他一大早就结了账离开了旅馆。

sentences.english: To follow up and take action on overdue trade debts.
sentences.chinese: 应收账超期超额的跟进及采取行动。

sentences.english: He checked out and went to the airport by taxi.
sentences.chinese: 他结了账离开旅馆乘出租车去了机场。

sentences.english: You should keep a record of how much you spend.
sentences.chinese: 你花了多少钱应该记个账。

definition: (accounting) to balance the books/to do the accounts/(fig.) to settle an account/to get one's revenge
let it be/let it pass/forget about it
to keep accounts/bookkeeping/to charge to an account
coin/money/CL:筆|笔[bi3]/unit of weight, one tenth of a tael 兩|两[liang3]
to verify accounting records/also written 對帳|对帐[dui4 zhang4]
to borrow money/to take a loan
